Class RandomPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • RandomPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PokerSquaresPlayer

    public class RandomPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements PokerSquaresPlayer
    RandomPlayer - a simple example implementation of the player interface for PokerSquares that makes random placements. Author: Todd W. Neller

    • Method Detail

      • setPointSystem

        public void setPointSystem(PokerSquaresPointSystem system,
                           long millis)
        Description copied from interface: PokerSquaresPlayer
        setScoreSystem - provides the player with the point system that will be used in subsequent games until a new point system is specified by the same method. Players can assume that (1) this will be the first method called on a PokerSquaresPlayer, and (2) it will be followed immediately by a call to init(). The amount of time allotted to the player to prepare for using this system is given by parameter millis. After the given number of milliseconds, or after the player returns from this method, the player should be ready to play. It is permissible to perform such computation on a separate thread, but the player should be able to play immediately after the return from this method or after the allotted time, whichever comes first.
        Specified by:
        setPointSystem in interface PokerSquaresPlayer
        Parameters:
        system - - new score system
        millis - - number of milliseconds allotted for player processing of the new point system

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: PokerSquaresPlayer
        init - initializes the player before each game
        Specified by:
        init in interface PokerSquaresPlayer

      • getPlay

        public int[] getPlay(Card card,
                     long millisRemaining)
        Description copied from interface: PokerSquaresPlayer
        getPlay - gets the current play position for a given card within the allotted number of milliseconds. Each card passed to getPlay has been drawn from the game deck. Each legal returned move will be made for the player. Thus, this method contains all information necessary to maintain current game state for the player. It is the player's responsibility to record its own moves, which and how many cards have been played, etc.
        Specified by:
        getPlay in interface PokerSquaresPlayer
        Parameters:
        card - - card just drawn.
        millisRemaining - - remaining milliseconds for play in the rest of the player's game.
        Returns:
        a 2D int array with the chosen (row, col) position for play of the given card.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from interface: PokerSquaresPlayer
        getName - gets the uniquely identifying name of the Poker Squares player. The name should be 20 characters or less.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface PokerSquaresPlayer
        Returns:
        unique player name
